net.fec.openrq.encoder

Interface DataEncoder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ArrayDataEncoder

    public interface DataEncoder
    A RaptorQ encoder for a data object.

    An encoder receives a data object (source data) and produces encoding packets (as specified in RFC 6330). The source data is divided into a fixed number of source blocks, and each source block can be encoded independently.

    An encoder provides a SourceBlockEncoder object per source block, and each takes care of actually encoding the source data into encoding packets. These encoder objects are accessed via the method sourceBlock(int), or the method sourceBlockIterable().

    The number of source blocks, the length of the source data and other parameters are specified as the FEC parameters. The method fecParameters() provides the associated parameters to the encoder.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long dataLength()
      Returns the length of the source data, in number of bytes.
      FECParameters fecParameters()
      Returns the FEC parameters associated to this encoder.
      int numberOfSourceBlocks()
      Returns the number of source blocks into which the source data is partitioned.
      SourceBlockEncoder sourceBlock(int sbn)
      Returns an encoder object for the source block with the provided source block number.
      Iterable<? extends SourceBlockEncoder> sourceBlockIterable()
      Returns a new iterable over all source block encoders.
      int symbolSize()
      Returns the size of a symbol, in number of bytes.

    • Method Detail

      • fecParameters

        FECParameters fecParameters()
        Returns the FEC parameters associated to this encoder.
        Returns:
        the FEC parameters associated to this encoder

      • dataLength

        long dataLength()
        Returns the length of the source data, in number of bytes. This value is the one returned by this.fecParameters().dataLength().
        Returns:
        the length of the data, in number of bytes

      • symbolSize

        int symbolSize()
        Returns the size of a symbol, in number of bytes. This value is the one returned by this.fecParameters().symbolSize().
        Returns:
        the size of a symbol, in number of bytes

      • numberOfSourceBlocks

        int numberOfSourceBlocks()
        Returns the number of source blocks into which the source data is partitioned. This value is the one returned by this.fecParameters().numberOfSourceBlocks().
        Returns:
        the number of source blocks

      • sourceBlock

        SourceBlockEncoder sourceBlock(int sbn)
        Returns an encoder object for the source block with the provided source block number.

        Bounds checking - If we have Z as the number of source blocks into which is divided the the source data being encoded, then the following must be true, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException is thrown:

        • sbn ≥ 0
        • sbn < Z
        Parameters:
        sbn - A source block number
        Returns:
        an encoder object for a specific source block
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the provided source block number is invalid
        See Also:
        numberOfSourceBlocks()

      • sourceBlockIterable

        Iterable<? extends SourceBlockEncoder> sourceBlockIterable()
        Returns a new iterable over all source block encoders. The resulting iterable can be iterated using a "foreach" loop.
        Returns:
        a new iterable over all source block encoders
